page.title: 17JOHN HENRY STOKES
page.content: JOHN HENRY STOKES BUILT THE HUNT STABLES AND OWNED MOST OF THE LAND IN GREAT BOWDEN.HE WAS BORN IN NORTH LUFFENHAM IN RUTLAND 1850.HE MOVED TO GREAT BOWDEN IN 1875 AND IT IS SAID THAT HE BROUGHT ONLY A PONY AND CART. BY 1900 HE WAS OFFERING FOR SALE BETWEEN 150 AND 200 OF THE FINEST HORSES IN EUROPE.HE BROUGHT LOTS OF PRINCES AND KINGS TO BUY HIS HORSES.THEY WATCHED THEM FROM THE FIRST FLOOR OF NEITHER HOUSE.IN NOVEMBER 1903 HE LOST AN EYE IN A SHOOTING ACCIDENT AND FOLLOWING THIS SOLD NEARLY HIS ENTIRE STOCK OF HORSES.STOKES WAS ONE OF THE SUCCESSFUL AND POPULAR HORSE BREEDERS AND HIS SKILLS DEVELOPED THE COB FOR HUNTING AND POLO PONIES.BUT HE DIED IN 1920.
